bioghist.p: Arnold H. Jolles succeeded Michael Botwinick as Assistant Director for Art of the Philadelphia Museum of Art in 1974. From 1977 to 1979 he served as Acting Director of Museum, filling that role after Evan Turner left and until Jean Sutherland Boggs arrived. From 1979 to 1986 he was Director of the Seattle Art Museum. In 1988 he was appointed interim director of the Bellevue Art Museum and later served as vice president and chief curatorial officer of the Eiteljorg Museum of American Indians and Western Art in Indianapolis.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Arnold Jolles' files from his time as Assistant Director for Art, 1970-1977 and as Acting Director, 1977-1979. These records document the Museum's planning for the Bicentennial, the reinstallation of the American Art galleries in 1975, exhibitions, the work of several corporate and departmental committees, general museum subjects, and the daily management of the Museum. The Assistant Directors records are arranged into five series: general subjects; curatorial and museum departments; meeting minutes, policies and grants; construction records; and Exhibition, installation, and event records. Materials include incoming and outgoing correspondence, minutes, memoranda, telephone logs and appointment calendars. The Acting Director records are arranged into five series: general correspondence; in-log and out-log files; museum subjects; “Treasures of Early Irish Art” exhibition records; and "Second Empire: Art in France under Napoleon III" exhibition records. Topics represented in the General subjects series include: security, building maintenance and capital programs, the Kienbusch collection; the Greater Philadelphia Cultural Alliance; the Bicentennial; loans and acquisitions; legal and personnel files; and damage reports.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
